poem:
The Cost of Borrowing  

The paper's ink,  
a tide of numbers rising,  
burying fields with the weight  
of interest and time,  
a long stretch since '98—  
brittle leaves billow  
in the gridlocked streets.  
Reeves, burdened by unseen hands,  
scribbles notes as autumn weeps  
beyond the ledgers,  
each borrowed breath,  
a crimson leaf's fall.
